definition: Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: It's the same proposal which investors in HKEx voted down last year.
sentences.chinese: 這與投資者於去年港交所反對的議案一樣。

sentences.english: Not all changes at HKEx under Mr. Li have been universally welcomed.
sentences.chinese: 李小加對港交所的改革並非都廣受歡迎。

sentences.english: Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing saw its profits grow 53 per cent and break through the $1 billion mark for the first time.
sentences.chinese: 港交所純利上升53%，首度突破十億大關。

definition: sum of money raised (in a share subscription)

pinyin: Xiang1 gang3 Jin1 rong2 Guan3 li3 ju2

definition: red chip stocks (Chinese company stocks incorporated outside mainland China and listed in the Hong Kong stock exchange)

pinyin: shou3 ci4 gong1 kai1 zhao1 gu3

definition: to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
to ration merchandise (esp. food in times of shortages)
